definitions.definition: moral principles that control or influence a person’s behaviour

examples.text: to draw up a **code of ethics**
He began to question the ethics of his position.

definitions.definition: a system of moral principles or rules of behaviour

examples.text: The ethic of personal achievement is very strong in Western societies.

definitions.definition: the branch of philosophy that deals with moral principles

wordOrigin: late Middle English (denoting ethics or moral philosophy; also used attributively): from Old French éthique, from Latin ethice, from Greek (hē) ēthikē (tekhnē) ‘(the science of) morals’, based on ēthos ‘nature, disposition’, (plural) ‘customs’.
